rm_classifier.helpers.yumap module

Y-shaped UMAP with Classification Head

Author: Johann Luca Kastner Date: 15/09/2025 License: MIT

class rm_classifier.helpers.yumap.ClassificationValidationCallback(validation_data, validation_loss_fn, metric_name='costum_loss')[source]

Bases: Callback

Callback to compute and log a classification validation loss at the end of each epoch.

__init__(validation_data, validation_loss_fn, metric_name='costum_loss')[source]
on_epoch_end(epoch, logs=None)[source]

Called at the end of an epoch.

Subclasses should override for any actions to run. This function should only be called during TRAIN mode.

Parameters:

  • epoch – Integer, index of epoch.

  • logs – Dict, metric results for this training epoch, and for the validation epoch if validation is performed. Validation result keys are prefixed with val_. For training epoch, the values of the Model’s metrics are returned. Example: {‘loss’: 0.2, ‘accuracy’: 0.7}.

rm_classifier.helpers.yumap.create_classification_loss_fn(model_instance)[source]
class rm_classifier.helpers.yumap.YShapedUMAPClassifier(classifier_head=None, umap_loss_a=1.929, umap_loss_b=0.7915, negative_sample_rate=5, n_classes=100, classification_loss_weight=1.0, keras_fit_kwargs={}, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: TrackedPUMAP

Y-shaped network that combines UMAP loss with classification loss

classifier_head

A keras model that takes the low-dimensional embedding as input and outputs class probabilities. Defaults to None, which builds a default classifier head.

Type:

keras.Model

umap_loss_a

UMAP loss parameter a. Defaults to 1.929.

Type:

float

umap_loss_b

UMAP loss parameter b. Defaults to 0.7915.

Type:

float

negative_sample_rate

Number of negative samples per positive sample. Defaults to 5.

Type:

int

n_classes

Number of classes for classification. Defaults to 100.

Type:

int

classification_loss_weight

Weight of the classification loss. Defaults to 1.0.

Type:

float

keras_fit_kwargs

Additional keyword arguments for the keras fit method. Defaults to {}.

Type:

dict

kwargs

Additional arguments for the TrackedPUMAP class.

__init__(classifier_head=None, umap_loss_a=1.929, umap_loss_b=0.7915, negative_sample_rate=5, n_classes=100, classification_loss_weight=1.0, keras_fit_kwargs={}, **kwargs)[source]

Parametric UMAP subclassing UMAP-learn, based on keras/tensorflow. There is also a non-parametric implementation contained within to compare with the base non-parametric implementation.

Parameters

batch_sizeint, optional

size of batch used for batch training, by default None

dimstuple, optional

dimensionality of data, if not flat (e.g. (32x32x3 images for ConvNet), by default None

encoderkeras.Sequential, optional

The encoder Keras network

decoderkeras.Sequential, optional

the decoder Keras network

parametric_reconstructionbool, optional

Whether the decoder is parametric or non-parametric, by default False

parametric_reconstruction_loss_fcnbool, optional

What loss function to use for parametric reconstruction, by default keras.losses.BinaryCrossentropy

parametric_reconstruction_loss_weightfloat, optional

How to weight the parametric reconstruction loss relative to umap loss, by default 1.0

autoencoder_lossbool, optional

[description], by default False

reconstruction_validationarray, optional

validation X data for reconstruction loss, by default None

global_correlation_loss_weightfloat, optional

Whether to additionally train on correlation of global pairwise relationships (>0), by default 0

landmark_loss_fncallable, optional

The function to use for landmark loss, by default the euclidean distance

landmark_loss_weightfloat, optional

How to weight the landmark loss relative to umap loss, by default 1.0

keras_fit_kwargsdict, optional

additional arguments for model.fit (like callbacks), by default {}

save(filepath)[source]

Save the model to a directory, handling circular references in callbacks.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – Directory path to save the model.

Returns:

None

transform(X, **kwargs)[source]

Transform new data and get embeddings, class probabilities, and class labels.

Parameters:

  • X (array) – New data to be transformed.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments for the superclass transform method.

Returns:

Low-dimensional embeddings. probs (array): Class probabilities. class_labels (array): Predicted class labels.

Return type:

embs (array)

fit_transform(X, class_labels=None, validation_data=None, val_train_split=0.2, **kwargs)[source]

Fit the model and transform the data.

Parameters:

  • X (array) – New data to be transformed.

  • class_labels (array) – Class labels for the samples in X. Used for classification tasks. Use -1 for unlabeled samples.

  • validation_data (tuple) – Tuple of validation data (X_val, class_labels_val). If None, a fraction of training data is used for validation. Defaults to None.

  • val_train_split (float) – Fraction of training data to use for validation if no validation_data is provided. Defaults to 0.2.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments for the superclass fit_transform method.

Returns:

Low-dimensional embeddings.

Return type:

embs (array)

set_fit_request(*, landmark_positions='$UNCHANGED$', precomputed_distances='$UNCHANGED$')

Configure whether metadata should be requested to be passed to the fit method.

Note that this method is only relevant when this estimator is used as a sub-estimator within a meta-estimator and metadata routing is enabled with enable_metadata_routing=True (see sklearn.set_config()). Please check the User Guide on how the routing mechanism works.

The options for each parameter are:

  • True: metadata is requested, and passed to fit if provided. The request is ignored if metadata is not provided.

  • False: metadata is not requested and the meta-estimator will not pass it to fit.

  • None: metadata is not requested, and the meta-estimator will raise an error if the user provides it.

  • str: metadata should be passed to the meta-estimator with this given alias instead of the original name.

The default (sklearn.utils.metadata_routing.UNCHANGED) retains the existing request. This allows you to change the request for some parameters and not others.

Added in version 1.3.

landmark_positionsstr, True, False, or None, default=sklearn.utils.metadata_routing.UNCHANGED

Metadata routing for landmark_positions parameter in fit.

precomputed_distancesstr, True, False, or None, default=sklearn.utils.metadata_routing.UNCHANGED

Metadata routing for precomputed_distances parameter in fit.

selfobject

The updated object.

__init__(umap_loss_a, umap_loss_b, negative_sample_rate, encoder, decoder, classifier_head=None, classification_loss_weight=1.0, **kwargs)[source]
call(inputs)[source]
compute_loss(x=None, y=None, y_pred=None, sample_weight=None, **kwargs)[source]

Compute the combined loss for UMAP, classification, and reconstruction.

Parameters:

  • x – Input data (not used).

  • y – True labels and reconstruction targets.

  • y_pred – Predictions from the model.

  • sample_weight – Sample weights (not used).

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments.

Returns:

Total loss as a scalar tensor.
